Protest.definition: a solemn declaration of opinion and usually of disagreement

1.definition: a solemn declaration of opinion and usually of disagreement

sub_terms.a: a solemn written declaration by a notary public or U.S. consul on behalf of the holder of an instrument (as a note) announcing dishonor and declaring the liability of all parties to the instrument for any loss or damage arising from such actionthe action of making or causing to be made such a declaration with due service of notice of dishonor
sub_terms.b: a declaration made by the master of a ship before a notary, consul, or other authorized officer upon arrival in port after a disaster declaring that any loss was not the fault of the crew but due to the disaster
sub_terms.c: a declaration made by a party esp. before or while paying a tax or performing a demanded act by which the declarer asserts that the justice or legality of the tax or act is disputed and that compliance is not voluntary

2.definition: the act of objecting or a gesture of disapprovala usually organized public demonstration of disapproval
